newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Yeltsin working on documents in hospital - spokesman.
newsitem.headline: Yeltsin working on documents in hospital - spokesman.

text.p: Russian President Boris Yeltsin, following strict doctors' orders, is spending two or three hours a day on paperwork, press spokesman Sergei Yastrzhembsky said on Friday.
"He has a work schedule of two or three hours a day," Yastrzhembsky told a news conference.

Doctors said on Wednesday that Yeltsin, 65, was fit enough for a heart operation, but that surgery would be postponed for at least six weeks. The operation -- a relatively routine bypass operation -- will improve the blood supply to Yeltsin's heart.
The president has been in the Central Clinical Hospital since September 13 and doctors expect him to stay there until the operation.

Yastrzhembsky said little had changed since doctors spoke to journalists on Wednesday. "For now he is in the Central Clinical Hospital. You have heard everything, there has been no lack of information, nothing essentially new has happened since then.
Yeltsin had two heart attacks last year and doctors say he may have had another one between the two rounds of Russia's presidential election
